title: Bride-to-be who piled on pounds eating son's leftovers loses 7st for her wedding
text:

A bride-to-be who piled on the pounds eating her young son's leftovers has lost 7st in time for her dream wedding in Florida.

Laura McPhait feared she'd be too big to fit in a plane seat - but has gone from a size 22 to a svelte 12 in the space of 11 months.

At her biggest, the mum-of-two, from Rhyl in Wales, tipped the scales at almost 20 stone, reports North Wales Live .

And her partner of six years, Dani Woolley has also lost six stone and the pair are excited to tie the knot a lot lighter in the city of Kissimmee on October 22.

(Image: Laura McPhait)

Laura, 29, said: "I always wanted to lose weight before I hit 30 so in January 2018, I thought new year, new me, and set out to lose two-and-a-half stone in time for my uncle's wedding in July.

"I joined the Rhuddlan Slimming World group and was surprised that I'd doubled my target by July so I just kept on going.

"By the time it got to Christmas I'd lost 7st 7.5lbs in 11 months and have kept the weight off ever since."

She added: "My downfalls used to be crisps, weekly takeaways and eating my son's leftovers.

"But I adapted really well to the changes and I never deprive myself of anything I fancy, I just find recipes that are the healthier version of the takeaways I love."

(Image: Laura McPhait)

(Image: Laura McPhait)

Laura has now started going to boot camp twice a week to help keep the pounds off - something she never thought would be possible.

Speaking about how much her life has changed, she said: "I would never have thought this was possible for me to be happy in my own skin after hating myself for years.

"I'd also never have thought I'd be able to run around and keep up with my boys.

"It’s things like being able to go into shops and pick up size 12 clothes and being excited to do clothes shopping because I used to be a size 22 so the options for clothes weren’t great.

(Image: Laura McPhait)

(Image: Laura McPhait)

"I also loved being able to try on so many different wedding dresses.

"When I started boot camp I couldn’t run or keep up and I felt so ashamed of myself at how unfit I was, but I refused to give up and now I can keep up and I love it so much.

"I even did the mum's race at sports day for my little boy and he was so proud of me doing that.

"I’m also so pleased I will not have to even think about if the seat belt will do up on the plane.

"Losing the weight has changed my life so much and I am determined to keep it off."

description: Laura McPhait, 29, used to gorge on crisps and weekly takeaways - but has now gone from a size 22 to a 12
